result.execSummary:
The defendant Millard C. Cooper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

6CM84 and 18CM108 called together. Defendant Millard C. Cooper in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Harper states there is a global resolution: In 16CM64-9mo in county jail. In 18CM108-2 years probation. Def pleads NC. Findings of guilty.

Count 1-9mo in county jail, with Huber. 61 days credit. 
Count 2-9mo in county jail, with Huber, concurrent to Count 1. 61 days credit. Costs converted to civil judgment. 

18CM108:
Count 1- Withhold sentence, 2 years probation. 
Count 2-Dismissed and read in. 
Count 3- Withhold sentence, 2 years probation.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Millard C. Cooper in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  13CM4/sentencing after revocation and 16CM84/plea and sentencing called together.

Atty. M states parties have an agreement:  In 13CM4, counsel are asking the Court to follow agent's recommendation of 9 month sentence on count 4 and 90 days on count 2, counts to run concurrent with each other; def to serve sentence now.  In 16CM84, def to plead to both counts for withheld sentence - probation 2 years.

16CM84 - def pleads guilty.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.

Sentence:  

13CM4 - 90 days jail on count 2 with huber; 9 months jail on count 4, concurrent with count 2, with huber.  Civil judgment on cost owed.  77 days credit.
16CM84 - 2 years probation with conditions that def obey rules of probation; attend, pay for, and succ. complete programs/counseling as ordered by agent; 1 set of costs; submit DNA sample. Credit in the event of revocation:  0 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court, on authorization, for Defendant Millard C. Cooper. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Millard C. Cooper not in court.  Atty. M states that def is presently incarcerated on a hold but unable to be present for this hearing due to med. issue; asks for adjournment of this hearing.  Court sets 9/21 at 3:30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 2, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant appears with Atty. Lisa McDougal.  ADA Forehand appears for the State.  Atty. M informs the Court the parties have reached an agreement; requests plea/sentencing date.  Court sets 9/2 at 3:30.
Status conference on August 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Def from R Co Jail

Defendant Millard C. Cooper appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail, in custody. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Millard C. Cooper.  Atty. M waives formal reading; enters NG pleas on def's behalf.  Court states the charges and informs def of his rights.  Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
